comment: Dr. Larson is such an amazing professor. This class was very easy and only very little work to do. As long as you do your work you will get an A. Take her!!!

Overall this class was okay. I am receiving an A in this class. I just would not take it again because she has a very liberal viewpoint on everything taught in class. I am a republican and she does encourage class discussion but I have always been too scared to say anything in class without being judged by her and my fellow classmates.
I never went to class and still got an A in her class. she gives out some extra credit you can do but all her tests and quizzes are online with no lockdown browser.

Very nice professor! We have a discussion every week and a test every month or so (sounds like a lot but its super easy). You can tell that she really cares about her students and throws in extra credit occasionally.

This class had really interesting topics but I did not enjoy attending class because of the way the lectures were presented. The chapter would have 20+ slides and we would go through maybe 8 of each before moving on. The group project was too vague and the final paper was annoying. Easy A and can get through but not worth going in person for.
Loved this class. Easy A. Most of it is online and open note, with easy material. They also care and can remember you. Definitely recommend if you're a soc major, or if you want an easy elective.
-Fine lecturers (nothing special) -If you do the work youll get an A -Easy class but not very informative

All her work is online and she doesn't use lockdown browser. There are quizlets for all her homework and test so you dont really have to show up to class. I like the class discussions but class is not mandatory. She gives weekly homework but like i said there are quizlets. In class lectures are 2 days a week but you can get by without showing up.

Prof Larsen is amazing! She can get a bit off topic during class, but it is still useful information we talk about. Her class is extremely straightforward. Do the assignments from the textbook, do what she suggests for exams and the final paper, and you'll be fine!
I took her class as a pre-req and so glad I chose her. Very caring and it's obvious she wants you to understand and have a passion for others. She gives out extra credit as well.

Larson is great! Attendance was not mandatory and you could basically do everything online, but she was always there to help. The material is fairly easy and you have a lot of opportunities to make an A in this class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took heronline during the pandemic & it was a breeze. Weekly discussion board and 10 question quiz (open note). 4 exams (open note) and a final. You need an access code for the quizzes which comes with an e-book. She is very understanding of the circumstances and even opened back up an assignment I missed during election week! Extra credit also!

I'm going to be frank, this lady has a hard time teaching the stuff we need to learn. She is a very sweet lady who really loves what she is doing, but she gets sidetracked on the lesson and is not helpful for the test. All of her material and exams are accessible outside of class which is how I passed.

She is a sweet lady, but she rambles about nonsense to no end. Can sometimes drive you a little crazy. She also asks thousands of questions that dont need to be asked. Very caring and nurturing, but doesnt keep topics on track.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: pretty boring and stupid class, but she is the easiest seminar teacher compared to everyone i have talked to. you have to go to class but you can just sit there and play on your phone. 10/10 recommend taking seminar as a HYBRID class. like fr do it or youll regret it

I did more papers in this class than my freshman english class.  She takes attendance, so if you miss a few classes, you are doomed.  If you get in an awful group like I did who doesn't bother to inform you when they meet, then you will have trouble.  Way too much work for a freshman seminar.  I got a C and I'm an a/b student.  Very disappointed.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Expect homework every week and a lot of reading. She is helpful but tends to ramble on subjects occasionally. No tests. Just a big group project.

I loved her because she was hilarious and you never know what shes gonna say. However, she assigns things without fully explaining. Her lectures are also very random so you never know what to expect. Class is a pretty easy A though
